title: 奈良美智點石成金！大筆一揮 100蚊變45萬

replies.msg:
本月的香港秋拍，日本當代藝術大師奈良美智作品，不單一日內兩度破拍賣紀錄，其更點石成金，將一張原本面值100元港幣，變成價值45萬元的藝術品。

蘇富比的香港秋季拍賣，昨日拍賣會上其中一件拍品，為一張經奈良美智「加工」的滙豐100元現鈔。有關作品最終落搥價36萬元，連佣金45萬元成交，升價4499倍。
另外，奈良美智之巨型裝置藝術《綠屋》，日前於保利香港拍賣會上，先以破紀錄4012萬元成交，至同日晚上蘇富比當代藝術晚拍，拍場上歷來尺幅最大的奈良美智畫布作品《背後藏刀》，以4,000萬元起拍，10分鐘後最終以破紀錄1.96億元（連佣金）成交；一日，內奈良美智拍賣紀錄急升近4倍，成為日本最貴藝術家。
我屌！

quote.msg: 我屌！

Hi Kaman,



Hope this email finds you well. This is Michelle, a reporter at Nikkei Hong Kong Bureau covering politics and business in Greater China.



I have been following your page and often find your comments on PR strategies very insightful. As we are now working on a story about how HK protesters battle with the government over public narratives on media, we would like to invite you for an interview to discuss the followings—



- What is your opinion on the HK government’s PR strategy (including overseas advertisements, daily press conference etc.)
- Why do you think global PR firms have declined to take up the governments’ campaign to rescue its battered reputation?
- Protestors have fight back with self-organized press conferences and various publicity work, how effective do you think these measures are?


Here is my latest coverage on the protest for your reference. Would be great if we can conduct a phone interview/meet in person the coming week. Looking forward to hearing from you soon!

https://asia.nikkei.com/Spotlight/Cover-Story/Running-out-of-options-Hong-Kong-protesters-dig-in
